alert.note: Alert for Collin; Cooke; Denton; Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 9:56PM CDT until June 15 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR DENTON...NORTHWESTERN COLLIN...COOKE AND SOUTHWESTERN GRAYSON COUNTIES... At 956 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Whitesboro to near Denton, moving southeast at 30 mph. At 955 PM CDT, ping pong ball size hail was reported near Sanger. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... McKinney, Frisco, Denton, The Colony, Corinth, Gainesville, Lake Dallas, Sanger, Whitesboro, Little Elm, Prosper, Celina, Krum, Pilot Point, Shady Shores, Aubrey, Krugerville, Collinsville, Cross Roads and Lindsay. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central Texas.
